thread.title: Tragic first picture of five-year-old boy who died after choking on food at primary school - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Tragic first picture of five-year-old boy who died after choking on food at primary school - Mirror Online

author: Allison Coggan
title: Tragic first picture of five-year-old boy who died after choking on food at primary school - Mirror Online
text:
Five-year-old Theodore Silvester died on Friday (Photo: Hull Daily Mail / SWNS) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A tragic schoolboy who died after choking on his food during a primary school lunch break has been named. 
Five-year-old Theodore Silvester died after being rushed to hospital on Friday after choking during a lunch break at Anlaby Primary School in Hull. 
Paramedics had battled to revive little Theodore in the school lunch hall as staff ushered pupils out of the room. 
A Humberside Police spokesman said: "The child who tragically died after becoming ill at Anlaby Primary School on Friday, February 3 has been named. 
"Theodore Silvester was five years old and was a foundation pupil at the school. Boy dies at Anlaby Primary School after choking on food during lunch break 
"A post mortem hasn't taken place yet, but the death is not being treated as suspicious. 
"His family are being supported by specially trained family liaison officers. 
"They have asked the media and the wider public to let them and the people who knew Theodore to come to terms with what has happened and grieve in peace." 
Hundreds of people expressed their sympathy for Theodore's family after news of his death was released on Saturday. 
Anlaby Primary head teacher Gareth May said: "The whole school community is deeply saddened by this tragic event and the thoughts of everyone connected with the school are with the child's family." 
An inquest is expected to be held at Hull Coroner's Court to investigate the circumstances surrounding the boy's death. The boy, who has not yet been named, was pronounced dead shortly after arrival. (Photo: Hull Daily Mail) 
Staff from East Riding Council are working with the school in First Lane to support staff and pupils as they cope with the death of one of their younger pupils. 
A council spokesman said: "Very sadly, we have been informed that a foundation stage pupil at Anlaby Primary School has died. 
"The council is offering close support to the school and to the child's family." 
One parent said: "Words cannot describe how awful this is. Everyone is just thinking about the family. It is so, so sad." 
Yorkshire Ambulance Service confirmed they attended the school in an attempt to save the boy's life. 
A spokeswoman said: "Following the tragic outcome, our thoughts remain with the family at this difficult time." Like us on Facebook
